website_summaries.verdict: More expensive than others, but it runs fast and efficiently versus other platter hard drive designs.
pros: Provides capacity choices ranging from 250 GB to 6 TB
Includes all of the latest hard drive technologies you'd expect to find in this price point
Built with vibration and corruption protection technologies
Designed with large cache memory area for maximum performance levels
cons: Carries a higher price point because this is the top hard drive model from Western Digital

customer_reviews.title: WD > Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Once upon a time I made the mistake of trying out the cheaper seagate sshd desktop models because it promised faster speeds and more storage for the price of wd black. Currently going through the tedious rma process of that drive which was used in a machine extremely infrequently until anything I tried to save on it kept giving me a disk read error. Switched back to wd black which Ive used for years in other desktops to replace that. Id rather stick to the 7200rpm black model and used a ssd for a boot drive than touch another seagate again. I didnt want to believe all the issues people said about seagate but wow they were not kidding.
customer_reviews.author: mtt

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money on WD buy a Seagate.
customer_reviews.text: Performance didn't meet specs, sh*t the bed after about 7 1/2 months, about a month after I moved over 140gb of movies, music, games, photos, and software to it to free up space on one of my older drives (Seagate) that still works perfectly. lost everything over 12 years worth of movies, music, games, photos, and software. I will never buy another WD HDD.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Chucking sound after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: Started making a popping/chunking sound after a week. Ive always been a fan of western digital so I expected this to be a fluke. After seeing another review having the same issue, I realized there may be a bad batch and should go with another drive. Returning this and going with the Gold Wd 6tb. Much cheaper and slower. All im wanting is a storage drive that will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: d258

customer_reviews.title: Click click. Click click.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the largest HDD I've ever owned. I paired it with 32GB of Optane memory, so the capacity and performance are fantastic. The only issue I have with this is the noise it makes every now and then. Click click. Click click. Click click. I haven't identified a specific time or process that it occurs, but it's annoying. It's not loud enough to make me think the drive is defective, but loud enough to be just above ambient room noise and notice it. Click click. Click click. Click click.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as labeled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to replace a failing 3Tb drive. When I installed it and got it recognized by the computer, it only showed roughly 2Tb of space. I thought that a bit odd, maybe there was something else going on and the disc would 'automatically' be partitioned or something (I'm not a computer geek). So I moved my files that I needed moved onto the disc.. and it filled 3/4 of the disc space.. from a 3Tb drive. So this is not a 4Tb by any stretch of the imagination. I think it's been mislabeled and is actually a 2Tb drive.
customer_reviews.author: R. Milne

customer_reviews.title: BE CARFUL . . . Failed after only 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Thought I had purchased a great drive, had always had good luck with WD drives, UNTIL this one, it only lasted 2.5 years. There is a 5 year warranty which is good, but of course they will replace it with a re-certified drive. And with COVID-19, the are only accepting "standard RMAs", which means I have to return the failed drive before they will send me a replacement. Makes no sense and is terribly inefficient, and horrible customer service!! Will purchase a NON-WD drive, install it, then send this drive for replacement, then re-install it for use to store "junk" files. Thank goodness I wasn't using this drive as my C: drive.
customer_reviews.author: Tressa D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is Shipping BAD Western Digital Hard Drives!!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! Do not think you can trust Western Digital or Amazon for this purchase! If you do buy this drive, test it immediately so you can return it to Amazon if needed! I could not get my HP PC to recognize this hard drive. After hours and hours of work and tests, Western Digital Support said the brand new drive was BAD! I waited past the Amazon return period thinking that I could rely on a WD performance drive but it was junk! Now I have to pay shipping to get a replacement. I see online many other people purchased bad WD drives from Amazon. WATCH OUT!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I got this on an amazon warehouse deal. It looks brand new. All of the reviews about DOA drives and drives failing after a week made me nervous. I don't think it's even been a week yet since I installed it. I used the WD Data Lifeguard to test the drive (extended test - takes about 8 hours for a drive this size), no problems. I do own an older WD Black 4TB drive. The older model is VERY noisy. This one is not. I'll update this review if something bad happens. A WORD OF ADVICE --- DO register the drive for the warranty! These drives have awesome warranties.
customer_reviews.author: jspuckett

customer_reviews.title: VERY noisy! Not everyone can live with it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so loud. It clicks and ticks and vibrates like crazy and the most annoying thing is that every 5-6 seconds it jerks the heads which makes a tick noise and sends a hard enough jolt, that I can feel it thru my desk. (This is a known issue, Its on purpose and its just how these HDDs work) This renders my super quiet and dampened rig pretty much pointless. It is very fast, but for me its not worth it, so Im returning it. Think hard If this is worth it for you before buying one.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Klempner

customer_reviews.title: BRAN'S SHOPPE VENDOR WARNING
customer_reviews.text: These drives are great. I have two 1TB HDDs that have been working fine for 4.5 years, however... BRAN'S SHOPPE sent me a "re-certified warranty replacement" drive on a listing that said it was "new". It started grinding/clicking two months in. WD Support informed me that the warranty from the original rolls over to the replacement, but this had expired. BRAN'S SHOPPE sold me a warranty replacement with an expired warranty for $105.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, very loud drive
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars because I'm not one of these newbies who needs a silent computer. I started computing in the late 80s, and have lived through the days of floppy drives that sound like an aircraft taking off. Yes, it is loud. People who are not used to loud drives will probably think something is wrong. Nothing is wrong; the drive is fast, and therefore loud. But it's a great value for the money. If you want a silent drive, look elsewhere. But if you have large data needs and can tolerate some noise, it's a joy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: It works, it's fast, it's loud... had to return it
customer_reviews.text: This drive was exciting and great and fast and outperformed the X300 6TB I am replacing it with. But it made too much noise. At idle, the drive made a rhythmic THUNKing noise that I couldn't stand. It interrupted train of thought, it just was too much of a drumbeat to be ignored. I checked and double checked... pulled the power cable to the drive and tested, then plugged back in. I ran hard drive tests of all kinds.... one taking over a day. I wanted to be sure the drive wasn't busted. It just thunks like the Tell Tale Heart. It had to go... sorry.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Product not same as picture in ad
customer_reviews.text: Got a 4 tb hd. But the product is not what it looks like in there photo. If you were to display this in a computer case it would be a regular looking hd. Not the one thats in the pc thankfully I’m not going to be displaying this so that’s why I gave it a 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Really loud, and Installation software is horrible
customer_reviews.text: It's been decades since I've heard a disk drive this loud. It sounds like a rat chewing through a wall every time the drive is accessed. Takes me right back to the 90s. And the installation software happily cloned my 2TB drive onto this new 4TB drive . . . and left 2TB inaccessible to the main drive. No hint in the software that it would not use the full capacity, they just assume you want to clone the limitations of your old drive. Took an hour of Googling to figure out how to access the other 2TB. WD is definitely not the leader it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Registry Issues- Resolved
customer_reviews.text: Product installed without issue, and isn't making noise like others have complained about. Tried registering at WD website and got pop-up saying it was OEM and warranty didn't apply. Frustrating. Not a product issue, but something isn't right with Amazon or WD. 4/30- Saw response from WD, thumbs up for prompt response. Called, but wasn't during business hours. Tried to re-register, this time entered a "zero" instead of an "O" that was between two other letters and product registered without issue. Happy customer. Also got $22 refund from Amazon since product went on sale today, two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Craig L

customer_reviews.title: Access denied
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Easy to install; Great capacity, 3.54TB usable; Con: The disk cant be accessed after 2 days use, Linux Deepin OS, no idea why, no abnormal operation at all. I lost all data and spent 16 hrs to get them recoveried. Noisy and hot, typically works @ 130+ F and, I could hear the virbrantion noise even though its in an enclosed case.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Auston

customer_reviews.title: This hard drive saved my life.
customer_reviews.text: My hard drives kept crashing every day if not two or three times a day. When I got this one it all stopped. First of all I didn't know I had two hard drive till my son in law got in there and started digging around in there. So imagine my surprise when he was able to move all my stuff from them over to the one. And I'm happy to say everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Died within a year. Will never buy another Western Digital HDD again.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the HDD since April 2019. I would hear the HDD spin and my computer would freeze for 2-5 seconds. I didn't think it was a big deal, but in March 2020 the computer doesn't recognize the HDD anymore. Yes, I know it has a warranty but I have Seagate HDD for years with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: James Augsburger

customer_reviews.title: It contains data
customer_reviews.text: My data, specifically. I put 2 TB of gaming goodness on it. FEEL THE GAMES, HARD DRIVE. It occasionally gets a bit loud, mostly when I'm playing stuff like FFXV, DeadFire, Dishonored 2, or the Outer Worlds on it. Understandable. Haven't had a problem with it yet. It was a simple open case, put in right spot, and plug it in kind of install, so super easy. Most online guides from reputable sources can guide one through it. Just don't be an incompetent technophobe, and you're good.
customer_reviews.author: J Giacomo

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: bought this in nov 2019 as of today aug 29 2020 it is dead, only used it for WINBLOWS 10. started acting up so i bought an ssd to replace it. luckily i had time to get my stuff off it
customer_reviews.author: Not the one

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This harddrive is working out really well. I was using an SSD Samsung 1T drive prior to installing this HD. For some reason, I noticed that my performance was not really great with the SSD Samsung 1T drive. So I experimented with going back to a regular drive with moveable parts. For some reason, my system loves this harddrive. It is a lot faster than using an SSD and more responsive. I am not yet sold on SSD Drives. From my experience, they do have some value for storage, but I have not had good luck with using them as a working drive. I am sticking with WD drives.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It's doing the job
customer_reviews.text: This drive makes a tiny amount of noise, and sometimes when I'm making the computer work on a processor intensive task there is more noise, but I think it's mostly the fan. It was easy to install, though I did have to take the screws off of another old hard drive (retired) to attach this into the dedicated space inside the new Dell. Good thing they all use the same size screws. There is no cable with this drive, you have to get your own SATA cable.
customer_reviews.author: A Close Reader

customer_reviews.title: 4th drive in 2 years and horrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: I thought these drives were supposed to be a higher tier than standard drives but the ones I've had seem to be troublesome. The first one arrived DOA and Amazon replaced that one with one that worked. That one lasted two years and then just died. It was still under warranty so I had a replacement shipped to me which I had to pay around $10 for the sipping. That one arrived DOA. Talking to tech support they said I could RMA that one but that I would also have to pay for the shipping again to send it back. I thought that was wrong as the drive they sent was DOA. Hopefully, the one they sent will last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Not a recent Model.
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Western Digital hard drives and those are my drives to go to yet today. This time, I was very surprised when I tried to register this drive and was not able to do so because of the answer that I received from WD was that this drive was very old and out of the warranty period. If I just bought it from Amazone as brand new, not use, how could it be very old? Anyway, I needed it and installed it, no problem, and there was nothing on the drive, like new and works as new, but unable to register for warranty porposes.
customer_reviews.author: Domingos Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: DOA - new in box, support is horrific
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading my desktop hard drive, figured to go 4tb Black. Ordered/received new 4tb, computer won't recognize it in bios, windows, etc. When connected via normal SATA, it prevents my main original hard drive from booting, and is constantly double-clicking. Tried reconnecting after boot as my SATA ports are hot-swappable, not seen in disk management. Finally tried via USB 3/SATA connector, still won't recognize. Tried contacting WD support via the phone number listed on their website, and chose option for Hard Drive - was connected with a rep that couldn't hardly speak English that said I had reached memory support, and he'd have the correct dept call me back.....still waiting.....SMH..... DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Pony

customer_reviews.title: The Best Mechanical Hard Drive I have Seen Yet
customer_reviews.text: This Drive is not only rock solid and reliable but performs very well Made a big Difference on my Dell Optiplex 760 Small Form Factor I,am Very pleased with this drive and if you want a new hard drive that's reliable and fast this is a good choice My Read Speed on sata 2 is 150 MB and my Write speed is 100 MB for Sata 2 that is awesome it not only makes using the computer more pleasurable its also quiet everything loads faster I,am a computer guru so you can take it to the bank that i,am honest trust me you wont regret buying this drive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works, but makes chunking/ticking noises.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these drives in May 2020, and it worked very well for three months. By August, however, it began making low-pitch ticking sounds, which is rather concerning. Its speed also decreased from ~250 MB/s to ~200 MB/s. Amazon was kind enough to replace it with a new one, but the new one makes the same low-pitch ticking sounds. Furthermore, with all my files removed from the old drive, its speed went back up to ~240 MB/s. Maybe these are normal sounds for a hard drive, but I still doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for Drobo Network Area Storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this WD Black 6TB Performance Hard Drive to replace a failed 4TB Drive in my Drobo 5N NAS. The 6TB drive added more capacity to my storage array. Western Digital drives have been historically been very reliable since the early days in the 1980s. I especially like purchasing WD Black Performance Drives as the read/write speeds are fantastic. Ordering from Amazon Prime allows me to order drives on-demand when I have a drive failure and don't have to stock a spare drive just in case. I've had two WD Black 4TB Performance Hard Drive failures in the last 3 months, however, the failed drives are 5 years old and expect more failures over the next couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Waite

customer_reviews.title: WD Black is worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: This HDD was purchased for use as a Time Machine backup in an external enclosure for my iMac. Works great! It is the improved version with what is claimed as more durable components and an improved design to reduce the possibility of becoming corrupted. I use WD Black HDDs in two more external enclosures, and the internal HDD in my iMac was recently upgraded to a WD Black by a local repair shop. They last a long time and are very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: K. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Confusing Description
customer_reviews.text: I did a search for an ASUS G60VX LAPTOP 1TB hard drive and this one came up, highly recommended. I read the specs (not the 3.5 vs 2.5 apparently - my bad). Just received this today and low and behold, it's too large for my laptop. Shocker. We contacted Amazon customer support and explained the confusion. No problem. I found the right one (Western Digital 2.5" 1TB hard drive). Under the compatibility, the description says "laptop, desktop" which is again, confusing. I'm rating this hard drive 3.5 for the confusion, NOT for the performance. If I was using this in a tower, it would probably do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin & Adrea.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Arrived dead on arrival. I'm now hesitant recommending this particular hard drive, getting good reviews over the years. I'm stuck in that I'm trying to mirror drives and need to get this same drive when one goes bad. But next time I build a system from scratch, I will not purchase these drives.
customer_reviews.author: William King

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality drive
customer_reviews.text: WD gaming class drive. Using as the primary drive in my desktop computer. Bought this as a replacement for an aging WD Black drive whose warranty expired in 2012. Replacing due solely to age. Would recommend for any build where you care about drive speed, stability and longevity. Would recommend -- WD professional drives are worth the investment. SSDs may be faster, but over the long haul my experience has been that the 7200 rpms are less likely to fail and or lose data.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Morgen

customer_reviews.title: Good performing HDD
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good performing 7200 RPM hard disk drive. With over a year and a half of use I haven't had any issues with it. This drive does produce a bit more sound relative to many other hard drives, but that is not unexpected for performance-oriented hard disk drives.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Karolak

customer_reviews.title: Very Noisy Drive (Constant Click-Click-Clunk-Click) 24 Hrs a day
customer_reviews.text: This drive is so Noisy I'm thinking of returning it. Even when it is idle (no reading or writing) it has a (Constant Click-Click-Clunk-Click) 24 Hrs a day. Due to the (Constant Click-Click-Clunk-Click) - I can't use this drive in my Video Editing/Vlogging Computer because my mike picks up the constant Clicking. I may keep it for my backup drive, although I have to wonder if the Noise is due to a defective drive or just poor design.
customer_reviews.author: APCS Technology Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet,
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased. Longer warranty, very quiet, I can not hear it on start up, and a good price for the memory. 7200 RPM verses 5600 fast down loads and uploads. I have a SSD for the OS on my computer, and use this drive for Post Photo and storage. Light room loads fast and saves fast. The first one has held up for about 4 years now. It is a little more money, but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Allen

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised... It's a WD Black.
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these 6TB drives in RAID for a total of ~ 11TB storage. They work well and haven't had any issues. They are replacing a 1TB WD Black that has been going strong for quite a few years. I was able to transfer 4.5TB of data from an external WD Blue 8TB with no issues. If you are going with a high capacity spinning disk you can't go wrong with WD Black. I've had 2 Seagate Barracuda drives die on me in the time I've had my previous WD Balck and the Black is still kicking and shows no sign of throwing in the towel. Highly recommended due to speed and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Funk

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This was well-packaged, undamaged; installed easily in the space left by my previous hard drive. Unfortunately, this particular item was DEAD! My computer wouldn't even boot up, and when I did get it up and running, the drive was just inoperable. Won't try again, I'll just stick with my 1TB WD drive, and consider myself lucky the computer still works!
customer_reviews.author: ChazW

customer_reviews.title: Lasting quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a number of hard drives in my time including those made by Seagate, Maxtor, Fujitsu and Toshiba, but Western Digital is the company I have come to trust when it comes to hard drives. All of the Maxtors I have owned have failed before I stopped using them. About half of the Seagate have as well. I finally had one Western Digital that is beginning fail on me about 13 years after I purchased it. Was still able to save most of the data from it. I also have another that I am still using after about 11 years with no issues. I have come to trust the Western Digital brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Device arrived non-functional. I've never had a problem with WD drives (I have 3 in my desktop already, plus a couple of externals), but this one arrived completely dead. Won't work in my external reader, won't work inside the machine. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Kal Teague

customer_reviews.title: Loud, but proud
customer_reviews.text: With speeds of up to 250MB/s that I've seen so far, this thing reads and writes insanely fast for an HDD. That said: it's the loudest, clickiest, whirriest drive I've ever owned. Let's be honest though, WD prioritized speed above all else in this HDD, noise is bound to happen. Just remember that the clicking is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny. S

customer_reviews.title: Solid drive
customer_reviews.text: For some of my pc's that un software for machines at work, i need a drive that can take a bit of a beating. WD tends to make some of the better drives and I have multiple different types in use. The WD Blue drives are just not durable enough to get hammered 24/7. The Black drives are however a little beefy and seem to last much longer. These are my go to when replacing original drives in pc's that just don't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good investment
customer_reviews.text: My first PC build from about 10 years ago featured a Seagate HDD. It failed within a year. Warranty replacement and major data recovery efforts later, new Seagate is uo and running. Within a week it began to fail, and the PCB actually caught fire. Replaced it with a Western Digital drive and haven't gone back. Used this 4tb WD Black on my dream rig along with a 1tb m.2. I love this drive and look forward to adding a second later.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fast but Loud
customer_reviews.text: Great Hard Drive for the price it’s nice to have as a large long term drive and game drive for my computer. I like that it’s incredibly fast but I dislike that it is probably one of the loudest things in my build. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a high performance drive that doesn’t mind the sound
customer_reviews.author: Jake L.

customer_reviews.title: HATE the rhythmic thump
customer_reviews.text: Apparently WD has implemented this new "feature" in the black series since the last, whisper quiet one I had. Now they have "Preventive Wear Leveling" (PWL) which causes it make this thump sound every 5 seconds. If you have your machine in a quiet place, this will make you absolutely crazy. It's like chinese water torture. Don't buy this drive if you want a quiet one.
customer_reviews.author: Don Caruana

customer_reviews.title: Had to return first one
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the one I ordered. Windows and BIOS would not recognize it and WD's Data Lifeguard failed it. I tried multiple SATA power and data cables and different SATA ports on the MB. I had Amazon send me replacement and the replacement worked 100% out of the box. I have been very disappointed with WD's quality of the past few years. I've never had a drive not work properly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene P

customer_reviews.title: Drive was a lemon! DOA
customer_reviews.text: Never have I had a HDD that was bad out of the box, but this one changed all that. Got numerous read and write errors when copying to it, and it failed Western Digital's own Lifeguard Diagnostic meaning the drive is bad according to tech support. They sent me a replacement drive that passed the same test. So the one from Amazon has serious issues and needs to be returned to the manufacturer. And I get to enjoy copying 2.5 TB from the bad drive to the replacement before it goes back. Lost days due to this; not cool...
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuru

customer_reviews.title: The Quietest of all my Drives
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet! I'm not sure what the matter was with others who have said this is a noisy drive, but I have it in an open Inatek dual drive dock, 30 inches from my ears, and it hardly makes any noise whatsoever. It's about the quietest drive I have (not counting the SSD drives). And I have noisy drives, too, so I know a noisy drive when I hear it (thinking of my 6-year-old WD Green drive, which is the noisiest of all my drives).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Yavelow

customer_reviews.title: DOA, terrible WD.
customer_reviews.text: So terrible. The HDD came to me dead, or should I say dying. I was not able to use this before the chirping noises started. I was then told that I was unable to install Windows onto it. That is forgivable. Technology cannot be blamed. What can be blamed is horrible WD. Dealing with warranty support was a nightmare to the point where I actually felt like I was being punished for returning this device? I should have went with Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolescu Tismaneanu

customer_reviews.title: How much Cache?  Was this a valid WD drive or some type of "fake"?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered six (6) of these Western Digital drives. Where it should say "SATA / 64 MB Cache", and the WD drive number/type (WD1003), it had something else (garbage - it made no sense to me). There is no way to check the cache amount without opening the SEALED bag, so I returned all six of the drives. Most of my other WD drives say 64 MB, although I have several older 32 MB, and one 128 MB, and this information is ALWAYS in the SAME location. Something didn't seem right. Was this a valid WD drive or some type of "fake"? And where is the WD drive number/type?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good hard drive for extra storage
customer_reviews.text: My main hard drive with my operating system and data is a 1TB solid state drive (SSD). However, I bought this Western Digital hard drive for extra storage and to use for Windows file versioning. It seems to be a good hard drive that is quiet and has fast enough read and write speeds. It is easy to install (assuming you are confident about opening up your computer box and moving things around). I'm quite satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: WD Black Label drives are excellent investments
customer_reviews.text: I built a custom gaming computer 4 years ago which booted from a SSD and used a 2TB WD Black Label HD for storage. It has served me faithfully. I've started scanning some old B&W and color transparency film and need more storage as come of the larger format scans can exceed 250MB. I again went with a WD Black Label drive. Neither drive was manufactured in China!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, fast and quiet
customer_reviews.text: My computer was full of data, instead of buying A new computer tower, upgrade the hard drive. Very easy to install, start up perfect. Had to purchase new “Windows” program but cheap if you get the program from a online company that “bay” to sell. Now quiet and fast. Also make sure to back up all your data. (Flash drive I purchased at Amazon also).
customer_reviews.author: kjk

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Was dying upon first use. All contact with amazon customer service was 'try this, do that, call this number, that number, wait for a call back' But they expressly promised that they "would make it right" - but just continued to stall until a day after the return date was lapsed. Then they refused to help, even after several attempts the best they would do is CHARGE ME to RESTOCK THE BROKEN ITEM. Which explains why I got a broken item in the first place. Found out that WD has non-existent customer service and an F rating at the BBB.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: VERY LOUD!! Do not buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Talk about a loud HDD! I know the second its reading/writing because the grinding is so loud. Same thing when it spins down when the PC is shutting off. It also appears to read/write slower than my original HDD. I wish i wouldn't have waited so long to install it as the return period was already over when i realized how loud and slow it is. I would have returned it. Instead, i swapped it out for my old HDD and have a $100 paperweight. Very unhappy with this HDD and would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: VERY Loud Feature
customer_reviews.text: Ticks very loudly every 5 seconds (I can hear it from across the room). I can feel each tonk vibrate through my desk. All diagnostics point the part being healthy. I looked this problem up extensively and found out it's not even a problem but a FEATURE called preemptive wear leveling. This is the loudest hdd I've ever bought. It makes my wd blue sound quiet next it. I'm going to try a few fixes I found on the internet but if those don't work I'm returning this loud piece of machinery by the end of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: 2TB Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have any complaints with this hard drive. I plugged in the various SATA cables and it worked like it was supposed too. I guess the only thing I could really say is maybe do some research on shucking external hard drives before you purchase something like this. You can oftentimes get 14TB for around 100$ if you are willing to do a bit of work and learning.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very Noisy PWL affect; Not fully recommended for Audio Recording/Music Production
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Noise. 5 second interval knocking, due to WD's Preemptive Wear Leveling (PWL) technology. WD provides no feedback or way to dial this back to a higher interval. If you need quiet drives for audio/vocal recording, this may not be the drive for you. Look for a quieter drive, but back up your data more frequently. If it were not for the noise, this would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Brown  III

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: This drive performs pretty dang well for a spinning disk. I usually see 100MB/s and up reads and writes. I have a 1TB NVMe drive that my OS and games I play the most on, but for the less often played games, or games that I don't really care about load time, they get loaded onto this drive. Even though it's not as fast as the NVMe drive, I don't ever feel like stuff takes an unreasonable amount of time to load, and that's what really matters to me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Givens

customer_reviews.title: I Only Buy WD HDDs
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's supposed to. Drive is fast, but I haven't benchmarked it. I've had it for a year or so and it's never give me any problems. In fact, after owning WD drives for 20+ years, I can't remember any failures. Seagate.........that's another story. I recommend WD drives to anyone needing a reliable drive.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: 5 months in and no issues
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to give a solid hard drive review 5 months after purchase, but I didn't want to wait years to review it (which is the lifetime I'd expect at minimum from it). It's ever so slightly noisy, but I only noticed when specifically listening for it. Overall, the case fans (which aren't very noisy themselves) are louder than it. I certainly wouldn't call it a noisy device. Just not completely silent. Pros: - As fast as expected for a 7200RPM HDD - Minimal noise Cons: - None so far. Will edit if any come up in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Patterson

customer_reviews.title: False Warranty Information
customer_reviews.text: Item says 5 years but Warranty only good for 3.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Bad Warranty Policy
customer_reviews.text: Meh...it stopped working about 1 month after I installed it. Smelled "burnt" like something had shorted out. Since it was obviously still under warranty I returned it and got a replacement. However, instead of sending me a new drive Western Digital sent me a "refurbished" drive. I am NOT comfortable putting my data on a "refurbished" drive. So...I gave the refurbished drive away and bought a new Seagate drive to replace it. Needless to day I am disappointed with Western Digital's warranty policy at this point.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I only use Western Digital BLACK hard drives because I really want to not lose any of my home videos, pictures and very important legal files, etc. It is heartbreaking if it happens. Even though they cost more money, I gladly paid it since I know a few people that have lost everything because of buying cheaper less reliable drives. So, I use one for the original and one as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Jimfl47

customer_reviews.title: Reliability is job #1
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to drive, and I'm responsible for a bunch of hard drives. While the HGST Ultrastar line does an admirable job, the Caviar Black drives just seem to be the most reliable, longest lasting drive I've come across. Sure, you could generally get 2 Seagate Barracudas for the price of one of these, but beware you may also have to replace it twice if you do. Save yourself the headache and pony up for the WD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 2TB Seagate Barracuda with this drive as I needed additional space. I found this drive to be significantly more noisy and initially quite a bit slower. I was able to run a repair on it, and now the speed seems to have improved. However, it still seems to be somewhat slower and is much more noisy than the Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Steve65

customer_reviews.title: Nice drive
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in a new build. My previous build was done 9 years ago, and I used a WD black 2 TB. I got a notice on the screen not quite 3 years in that said the drive was failing. I contacted WD and they sent a replacement out very quickly. I was able to transfer data from the failing drive to the new drive, then sent the failing drive back. Credit was made very quickly to my card for the return. The experience with WD was good enough that I decided to use a 4 TB black on the present build.
customer_reviews.author: FBSDMD

customer_reviews.title: Loving this drive.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this drive to perform as a physical backup for all of my data, but after installing it and using it for a while, I decided to just order another one so I can use this one as extra storage. The WD Black 7200 rpm is an affordable, high capacity storage device that doesn't disappoint with read/write speeds. After a few minutes of installing/formatting the drive, it was up and running with no issues. This drive is extremely quiet to my surprise. It doesn't include SATA cables or the mounting screws, so make sure you own some/order some along side it. 5/5- WD doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drives
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these drives for 10 years and I have almost a dozen of them. They are excellent drives and so far I have had NO failures even though some of them are long out of warranty. They are fast, quiet and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: E. Guyer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks WD for another great product
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Western Digital Hdds in my builds and systems. They have almost always been of the highest quality with great support. This one is no different. Plenty of space, and great speed. If you want to use more than 2 terrabytes however, you have to convert from MBR to GPT. Then you can partition it out however you want or just use the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my VLC artifact issue.
customer_reviews.text: My other 2 drives kept giving me horrible playback on VLC. I would keep getting gray artifacts all the time and would notice the HDD activity light on my pc start flashing during them. So I though maybe I'd give this a try and sure enough no more gray artifacts in VLC. It also plays my games but I don't really notice that much of a difference, maybe there is some better load times but I haven't tested that. All I know is the games do play well, the movies play very well off this drive and I've had no problems whatsoever with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dillon

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Could not initialize. I/O error. Unable to format, partition, initialize, or use at all. Wish I had installed it right away to find out it's a DOA, now I will probably have to go through WD warranty to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Ethron T Young

customer_reviews.title: Does not improve performance.
customer_reviews.text: Not any better than a cheaper drive. Failed in less than 2 years, but they replaced it. It took months to restore some of data lost and some will never be restored. I have a yellow storage drive that runs as good as the black. In my book the black is not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Dependable
customer_reviews.text: These drives are Pretty Dependable, what I mean is...they are great for audio streaming but when hear the infamous clicking sound it’s time to back it up at once and buy a new one. I’ve used these drives fo many many years and I’ve found they last on an average of 5 years then it’s time to move on. SSD drives are way better and faster for audio recording but when they die...there’re dead. I’m slowly moving to SSD drives in my system but they are way expensive still. I do regular backups 😎.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R Lowther

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and very noisy HDD
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging - The shipping box was too large and there was no bubble-wrap protecting/cushioning the small box with the HDD. Most likely the HDD moved and was shaken during transportation. I do not know if the mistreatment will affect the long-term function of the HDD. Very noisy - This is my 3rd WD2003FZEX HDD and it is very noisy compared with my other two as well as with two Seagate HDD of similar characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. R.

customer_reviews.title: Not as noisy as one might think
customer_reviews.text: It formatted and worked right out of the box. It don't think it is as noisy as some reviewers have stated, but since I have worked around really big diesel engines for many years, maybe I am just deaf. In any case, it does its job well, and stores my files and backups as intended.
customer_reviews.author: groundhog

customer_reviews.title: Reliable storage and capacity at a competitive price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used hundreds of Western Digital Black drives at a major research university and at home for over 25 years and have always found them to be one of the most reliable, cost effective, quiet and fast storage devices available. Of course, as with any manufacturer you do occasionally get a bad one on arrival but I always suspected some of these to be due to shipping packaging and handling.
customer_reviews.author: ghudson58

customer_reviews.title: Great HDD! First time ever getting a DOA. Would still buy again!
customer_reviews.text: WD:black have always been great hdd and I've always used them for my gaming rigs as well as high access drives. I've still got one that's well over 10 years old and it still works like a champ for its size. The first drive I received when placing my order did unfortunately arrive DOA which is honestly the first time I've ever gotten a dead one. I've had motherboards and other devices be DOA but not these hdd. All in all they're great drives, high speed, quick to respond and usually last a very long time as long as you give them a little down time every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Bought this on Prime Day and Didnt work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive on prime day and it came to me broken. wasnt offered a replacement was just offered the ability to return it. I received it after prime days had ended so i no longer had access to the deal price which was much lower then it normally sits wish amazon wouldve helped with that. So be warned shipping is hard on these drives id stick to buying them in store if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Deleon

customer_reviews.title: DOA drive
customer_reviews.text: DOA, plug it in, just beeps, gparted can't read it, smartctl shows errors and can't load information. Dmesg shows an issue with sector 0. Never had a new drive show up dead, for the money and the hype, nope. I hope the rma goes better than some reports I have seen here.
customer_reviews.author: Boy of Destiny

customer_reviews.title: This HHD has great performance but..
customer_reviews.text: Read and Write speeds of this product are respectable; nothing wow factor thou. It was easier to install and my motherboard found this drive the first time. I didn't run into any errors while setting this drive up. One thing that did annoyed the hell out of me was the"hmmm" sound it creates when running. It took me about 2 hours to find where the noise was coming from. When this drive is running, it vibrates more compared to other traditional HHD drive. When fitted into tower it will create "hmmm" noise especially if you have itx/mATX tower.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Slow, noisy and sometimes freezes up.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this drive for two months now and it hasn’t performed well. Constantly makes clicking and other noises like something is wrong. It also slows down my PC and sometimes freezes up. Gaming is also slow. Past my window to return so I’m stuck with it. Should have suspected a bad product when it arrived in plain brown packaging and not a sealed manufacturer’s original box. I don’t recommend this drive at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1TB SSD and 1TB HD
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to a 1TB SSD WD drive and a 1TB WD Black hard drive. OS and such on the SSD while all my games are on the 1TB WD Black hard drive. Overall my system is about 20% - 30% faster. Steam, Epic and Bethesda all now have their individual folders to install games.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I love Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: This drive is really the best hard drive for home use. It is the top of the line performance drive from Western Digital. I have zero issues with these drives and I've been using them for more than a decade. Treat them right, and they will last you a lifetime without wearing down, well past their warranty period. I cannot recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Caaaaarrrrlll

customer_reviews.title: FAKE DRIVE FROM SELLER I OBTAINED
customer_reviews.text: The drive arrived poorly packaged but still in one piece thankfully. However when tested it reported 0gb. Umm, it was supposed to say 2tb? And the manufacturer said Sandisk? I immediately started the return process and am waiting for the refund. I’m never buying from WD as I do not want to get scammed a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: WD Black 4TB Performance Hard Drive - WD4005FZBX is working well for me.
customer_reviews.text: WD Black 4TB Performance Hard Drive - 7200 RPM, SATA 6 Gb/s, 256 MB Cache, 3.5" - WD4005FZBX arrived promptly and undamaged. It is very fast; and it is quiet for a fast drive. It does not run hot.my files transferred from my WD 1 TB hard drive with no problems. I really like the extra room for my files.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas ll

customer_reviews.title: this is good. I need something reliable and not temperamental
customer_reviews.text: When ssds won't die from power outages or in general, and will cost the same as spinning hard drives, when they will be a reliable option for storing massive amounts of stuff, then I will consider them. For now, this is good. I need something reliable and not temperamental.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drive, tons of space, piece of cake to install and set up. No clicking noise that I can hear. I'm expecting WD reliability, just like the last 10 drives I have owned. Bear drive, nothing in the box except the drive, just as expected. I just unplugged the old drive and plugged in this new drive for lots of new space. WD Black = speed and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: extrabilly

customer_reviews.title: TWO IN A ROW DOA
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if they had a bad batch or what, I've never had a bad HDD, and I considered WD Black to be the Cadillac of HDD's. To have two in a row show up DOA, I don't know if there was an event at the warehouse, or at the manufacturer, or what, but I've given up on WD and I'm going to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performing HDD
customer_reviews.text: Works great for gaming. I have this drive paired with a 1tb version (wd black) and my OS is on a Samsung 250gig ssd for my OS. The hard drives work great for storing everything else like my games and such and I don’t really have any complaints in regards to loading times and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, rock solid reliability.  My reference ProTools drive.
customer_reviews.text: WE'D Black drives are my reference standard for ProTools record drives. I have twelve of them, mostly 1TB but some 2TB, and have never had a failure in four years. I usually replace them after two to three years but literally have zero failure history with them after four years of very heavy use. I can't recommend them highly enough! I have benchmarked these drives at a reliable 128 tracks recording at 24bit 48kHz on an eSATA controller. That's ridiculous but they do accomplish it easily. I typically allocate no more than 32 tracks per drive when using them for editing and post production but they can accommodate much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Yianilos

customer_reviews.title: Odd “bump” noise
customer_reviews.text: Stores data? Yes. Easy to install? It’s a hard drive. It has two plugs. Makes obnoxious “bump” noise every 5-6 second even when idle? Yup. This would probably be fine if your pc isn’t in the same room but it was driving me nuts. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Can't use all 4TB!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine until I found I am unable to utilize 1.6TB of space. To use that space I have to convert the drive to GPT. However it apparently cannot be done on this drive using (Admin) command prompt. I should note that I have an SSD to boot my system and have recently done a fresh install of Windows 10. Still this should not be a problem. I am also aware I can use third party applications to remedy this issue. However I should not be required to do so. Had I been made aware that this was an issue with this rive I would have second thoughts on it's purchase. This is overall ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Fast and large.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I went with the larger 6TB capacity because my computer storage needs are only going to grow in the future. Using this to store home video files which are quite large and there are a LOT of them. This drive is faster than most mechanical drives and the capacity can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: mmarkows

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I trust this drive.
customer_reviews.text: I have it formatted for Mac OS. I monitor my drives with Drive DX. From the start this drive shows up as Overall Health Rating : GOOD 84.9% Overall Performance Rating : GOOD 84.9% although it fluctuates between this and 90.7%. This is a brand new drive so I don't know what's up. It is load into a 2 bay dock.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: Always good performance from WD Black drives
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and installed as part of an 8TB server array - These drives have good response time and a great warranty. I always select WD black drives if I need a mechanical hard drive unless a red is the better choice (backup drives). Would (and will) purchase again...
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 1TB Seagate (that went bad... the first HD I've ever had go bad... according to Seagate's own program). I chose this over purchasing a SSD because of the cost (MUCH less), and the simplicity of cloning. I was disappointed that the WD program (Acronis True Image) to clone hard drives left me with a hard drive that did not boot after the first time. So I tried Marcium Reflect and now things are up and running as they should be. I gained the extra TB by using Windows 10 partition utility. It is fairly noisy but I can live with it. Especially since it seems to have ramped up the speed of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High capacity, great reputation, ease of installation.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a passport external drive that was becoming noisey. WD Black hard drives have a great reputation for long turn reliability. No issues putting this drive in an existing system, faster operations than usb passport.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The best drive you can bu
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the best drive you can buy. After 30+ years of servicing computers for a living - and 14 years of doing data recovery in the Dallas, Texas area, the only brand of hard drive I use / sell is Western Digital. They have the best performance and reliability. Period. The Black drives are 7200 RPM and hold up really well. You get great performance from them for most purposes. The Red and Purple series are more appropriate for data centers or security DVRs, but you could still get by with the Black drives in these situations is you were on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Another win for WD
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Much storage -Crazy long warranty -Not DOA! -Fairly quiet CONS: -None yet! I haven't owned this hard drive for long, but if there's anything I've learned with hard drives, it's that if it isn't DOA and a Western Digital, you're pretty much good to go. These black drives by them are definitely worth the extra money for the longer warranty as well. It runs fast(at least for being a non-ssd), and is a great secondary drive for those just looking to up their storage. I've never had any problems with Western Digital and have only really ever seen bad things from Seagate, so I'm going to be sticking with them for the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Assmus

customer_reviews.title: Two failures now, one within a year
customer_reviews.text: The first time it started adding up bad sectors quickly after four years. Four years is a little short, but I got a replacement under warranty JUST in the nick of time. That replacement is dying now, one year later. Still under warranty for a few months but I don't see the point in setting myself up for future failure with another refurbished lemon; I need my computer and I need the information on it. Just giving up on WD and going elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A Person Making Reviews On Occasion

product_meta.title: Western Digital 1TB WD Black Performance Internal Hard Drive - 7200 RPM Class, SATA 6 Gb/s, , 64 MB Cache, 3.5" - WD1003FZEX
product_meta.description: Capacity:1TB| Pattern Name:Hard DriveWD Black performance storage is designed to enhance your PC experience across heavier computing tasks whether you are a digital artist, video editor, photographer, or gamer. Available with an impressive 256 MB of DRAM cache on higher capacity models, the WD Black drive is optimized for drive performance so you can spend more time experiencing the things you love most. Enhance your PC’s performance even further when you combine a WD Black drive with an SSD for a dual drive configuration, allowing you to benefit from the additional caching of your operating system onto the SSD for increased performance. All together, the WD Black drive gives you the hard drive performance, capacity and an industry leading 5-year limited warranty for an inspiring three-in-one storage solution.
feature_bullets: Next-generation desktop performance hard drive designed to intensify your PC experience
Performance storage available in up to 6TB capacities
2X DRAM cache up to 256 MB for faster read operations
Designed for creative professionals, gamers and system builders

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,391 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
